title: Baby fights for life after ‘being beaten by mum who left to go on date’
text:
Warning: Graphic and upsetting content

Baby Mykyta is in intensive care after allegedly being beaten by his mother (Picture: 1+1)

A newborn baby has been left in a serious condition after allegedly being beaten by his mother.

The tot, named Mykyta, was discovered by neighbours with a bloodied nose and soiled clothing.

His mother is accused of abusing him before she left him alone so she could go out on a date.

Mykyta was taken to a local hospital in the city of Rivne, Ukraine, where doctors said they had never seen a child with such bad injuries.

He is believed to have fractures to his skull but they have been unable to fully examine him yet because of his grave condition.

Neighbours found the tot with a bloodied nose (Picture: 1+1)

Mykyta, who is around four weeks old, is now in intensive care and doctors say they don’t think the mum ever changed his clothes.

Local media reports said that the baby boy lived with his mum, who has not been named, in a social hostel.

His dad, 27, reportedly has no interest in his son.

Neighbour Tetiana Prymak was one of the neighbours who went to check on him after realising his mother, 19, had been out all day.

She said: ‘When we entered the room we saw Mykyta in his crib.

‘His right eye was black. His nose was blocked with baked blood and he was barely breathing.

‘We started changing his clothes and saw black bruises all over his body.’

Doctors are caring for the one-month-old in hospital (Picture: 1+1)

The neighbours called an ambulance and the police and the mother is now currently in police custody.

Head of the intensive care unit of Rivne Regional Children’s Hospital, Mykhailo Kulik, said: ‘The boy is in a serious life-threatening condition.

‘We suspect that his skull is fractured but we cannot examine it now.

‘I have never seen a baby in such a terribly neglected state. I think his mother has never changed his clothes nor used diapers. His skin is in awful condition.’

The mother, whose name has not been released, is being questioned by police (Picture: 1+1)

The mother was taken to the police station after she returned home from her date.

She has told police she did not touch Mykyta and his injuries were caused by a ‘cold draft.’

Police have launched a criminal case for battery and failure to fulfil parental duties against her.

She faces up to five years in jail if convicted.

Police spokesman Anton Kruk said: ‘The mother said that she was stressed out because of the baby’s constant crying.

‘She left the baby home alone and went on a date.’

Once the baby leaves hospital, he will be taken into the care of social services.
